00002 #define _ESM_CREA_H

00007 namespace ESM

00009 
00010 /*
00011  * Creature definition
00012  *
00013  */
00014 
00015 struct Creature
00016 {
00017     // Default is 0x48?
00018     enum Flags
00019     {
00020         Biped = 0x001, Respawn = 0x002, Weapon = 0x004, // Has weapon and shield
00021         None = 0x008, // ??
00022         Swims = 0x010,
00023         Flies = 0x020, // Don't know what happens if several
00024         Walks = 0x040, // of these are set
00025         Essential = 0x080,
00026         Skeleton = 0x400, // Does not have normal blood
00027         Metal = 0x800
00028     // Has 'golden' blood
00029     };
00030 
00031     enum Type
00032     {
00033         Creatures = 0,
00034         Deadra = 1,
00035         Undead = 2,
00036         Humanoid = 3
00037     };
00038 
00039     struct NPDTstruct
00040     {
00041         int type;
00042         // For creatures we obviously have to use ints, not shorts and
00043         // bytes like we use for NPCs.... this file format just makes so
00044         // much sense! (Still, _much_ easier to decode than the NIFs.)
00045         int level;
00046         int strength, intelligence, willpower, agility, speed, endurance,
00047                 personality, luck, health, mana, fatigue; // Stats
00048         int soul; // The creatures soul value (used with soul gems.)
00049         int combat, magic, stealth; // Don't know yet.
00050         int attack[6]; // AttackMin1, AttackMax1, ditto2, ditto3
00051         int gold;
00052     }; // 96 bytes
00053 
00054     struct AIDTstruct
00055     {
00056         // These are probabilities
00057         char hello, u1, fight, flee, alarm, u2, u3, u4;
00058         // The last u's might be the skills that this NPC can train you
00059         // in?
00060         int services; // See the NPC::Services enum
00061     }; // 12 bytes
00062 
00063     NPDTstruct data;
00064 
00065     int flags;
00066     float scale;
00067 
00068     std::string model, name, script, original; // Base creature that this is a modification of
00069 
00070     // Defined in loadcont.hpp
00071     InventoryList inventory;
00072 
00073     bool hasAI;
00074     AIDTstruct AI;
00075 
00076     std::string mId;
00077 
00078     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string& id);
00079 };
